action.action-desc: Mr. Thompson of Pennsylvania (for himself and Mr. Gene Green of Texas) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources

form.official-title: To amend the Mineral Leasing Act and the Energy Policy Act of 1992 to repeal provisions relating only to the Allegheny National Forest.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Cooperative Management of Mineral Rights Act of 2017.

section.header: Repeal of provisions regarding the Allegheny National Forest

subsection.text: Subsection (o) of section 17 of the Mineral Leasing Act (30 U.S.C. 226) and section 2508 of the Energy Policy Act of 1992 (Public Law 102–486; 106 Stat. 3108) are repealed.
Nothing in this Act shall be construed or interpreted—

paragraph.text: to limit, modify, or otherwise affect the existing requirement to provide in writing 60-day advance notice of specific activities in accordance with the order dated December 16, 1980, in the case United States of America v. Minard Run Oil Company, 1980 U.S. Dist. LEXIS 9570 (W.D. Pa., Dec. 16, 1980); or
to limit existing authority of the Forest Service under provisions of law codified in section 551 of title 16, United States Code.

subsection.text: Nothing in this Act shall be construed or interpreted to alter, repeal, or otherwise limit the existing authority of the Forest Service to permit the harvest or sale of timber derived from the Allegheny National Forest.
